extractions.description: This paper studies the damping signatures at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO), a medium-baseline reactor neutrino oscillation experiment, with a focus on various new physics models such as quantum decoherence, neutrino decay, neutrino absorption, and wave packet decoherence.

title.value: Damping signatures at JUNO, a medium-baseline reactor neutrino oscillation experiment
title.justification: It is the complete and specific title provided by the author(s).
title.quote: Damping signatures at JUNO, a medium-baseline reactor neutrino oscillation experiment

type.justification: The paper presents empirical data and results from a specific experiment (JUNO) and investigates the impacts of various models on this data.
type.quote: We study damping signatures at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO), a medium-baseline reactor neutrino oscillation experiment.

research_field.justification: The study is conducted within the domain of particle physics, focusing on neutrino oscillation experiments.
research_field.quote: We study damping signatures at the Jiangmen Underground Neutrino Observatory (JUNO), a medium-baseline reactor neutrino oscillation experiment.

sub_research_field.justification: The research focuses on neutrino oscillation, a fundamental topic in particle physics.
sub_research_field.quote: These damping signatures are motivated by various new physics models, including quantum decoherence, ùúà3 decay, neutrino absorption, and wave packet decoherence.
